text:
NEW YORK, Oct. 6 (UPI) -- Taylor Swift continued her famous "1989 Secret Sessions" last week and invited several fans to her NYC apartment on Friday so they could listen to her upcoming record before its released on Oct. 27.

On Thursday, the singer held another event at her Rhode Island home. The 24-year-old star shared several photos from the gatherings on Instagram Saturday under captions like: "NYC memories" and "Miss you already".

Advertisement

The "Shake It Off" singer held the first of her "1989 Secret Sessions" on Sept. 20, for which 35 fans were invited to her Los Angeles home to munch on home baked cookies and listen to the singer's unreleased new album.

At the events, fans are required to leave all their belonging behind before entering Swift's home to sample "1989," her first official pop album, and to hang out with the star.

Advertisement

The "Shake It Off" singer held a second Secret Session in her Nashville home on Sept. 29.

On Sunday Swift took to Instagram to thank fans for "illuminating her night and her life" and promised there were "so many other things coming up and I can't wait to meet you." The pop star might be taking her surprises abroad as she later shared a photo of herself on her way to the airport.
title: Taylor Swift invites fans to her NYC, R.I. homes for more '1989 Secret Sessions'

meta_data.description: Taylor Swift continued her "1989 Secret Sessions" Friday and invited several fans to her NYC apartment so they could listen to her upcoming record "1989."

og.title: Taylor Swift invites fans to her NYC, R.I. homes for more '1989 Secret Sessions'
